content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron plate production structure at position around (16, 71) to (21.5, 73.5)
Consists of the following connected entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) extracting iron ore
- Burner inserter at position (17.5, 71.5) moving ore from mining drill to furnace
- Stone furnace at position (17.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates
- Burner inserter at position (14.5, 73.5) extracting iron plates from furnace onto transport belts
- Transport belts connecting furnace output inserter at (13.5, 73.5) to assembling machine input inserter at (24.5, 73.5)
- Assembling machine 2 at position (21.5, 73.5) set to craft iron gear wheels from iron plates
- Burner inserters at (19.5, 73.5) and (23.5, 73.5) respectively taking iron gear wheels from assembler and feeding iron plates into assembler
- Wooden chest at position (18.5, 73.5) collecting iron gear wheels from output inserter
- Small electric poles at (21.5, 75.5) and (14.5, 71.5) intended to power the assembling machine and inserters, connected in an electricity group

ERROR TIPS

### Errors related to placing entities where inventory lacks the item
- Ensure the required item is present in inventory before attempting to place it (e.g., assembling-machine-1 was not in inventory when placement was attempted).
- Double-check inventory contents before placement commands.

### Errors when connecting transport belts directly from furnaces
- Transport belts cannot be connected directly from furnace entities.
- Always use an inserter to extract items from furnaces and use the inserter as the source entity for belt connections.

### Errors when placing entities on occupied tiles
- Placement failed when trying to place burner inserters or electric poles on tiles already occupied by other entities (wooden chest, burner inserter, or other objects).
- Use increased spacing, change direction, or adjust reference position to find free tiles for placement.
- Implement checks to confirm tile availability before placing entities.

### Errors related to power supply and electricity connections
- Assembling machine reported no power despite electric poles placed nearby.
- Ensure electric poles are correctly connected and cover all powered entities.
- Verify that the electricity network is continuous and that poles are placed on valid positions without obstruction.
- Check that power poles are properly connected to each other to form a valid electricity group.

### Errors in code logic and type usage
- TypeError due to treating a boolean as iterable when checking assembler power status.
- Validate variable types before iteration; ensure that functions expecting iterables receive correct data types.

NAMESPACE

No user-defined functions have been reported in the logs so far.
